summary: Witchcraft is the belief in using magical powers, often to cause harm. Witches are people who practice witchcraft. This belief is found in many cultures worldwide. In Europe's past, women were often accused of witchcraft, leading to witch-hunts and trials. These accusations were sometimes due to social tensions. Some cultures believe witches have evil spirits or substances inside them. Today, some modern pagan groups use the term witchcraft for their practices, while others avoid it due to its negative history.
title: Witchcraft
